page.title: 12RESIDENTIAL USE OF FARMHOUSE
page.content: Dunton Lodge is in Bedfordshire. The owner farms four hundred acres in Bedfordshire and about a thousand in Standon, Hertfordshire, about 20 miles away. The owner is growing oilseed rape which is a new crop to him and a comparatively new one in this country. After harvesting the seeds are crushed and the oils are extracted and used for making low cholesterol margerine and cooking oil Most farms had paddocks for horses when they were used on the farm. This farmer enjoys riding and keeps two horses in a paddock. They are sometimes joined by two heiffers.The owner of Bluegates keeps horses as well. The Cambridgeshire Hunt can be seen in the area in the late Autumn and Winter The Lodge is rented to a plumber. Many farm buildings are useful to both craftsmen and tradesmen.
